9.text: John Watson: Sherlock! We’ve received a letter,

12.text: in this day and age. How curious …

15.text: Sherlock Holmes: Yes John, about as curious

16.text: as a dog that doesn’t bark …

18.text: Hnh! Type-written, and with a dandy roll watermark

22.text: JW: Dear Mr Holmes, I wouldn’t bother you …

25.text: Mary Westmacott: … if I didn’t think my life was in danger.

30.text: It’s absurd, but I’m being haunted

35.text: I’m a screenwriter and was recently commissioned

39.text: a film about a missing boy.

43.text: and for once the contract terms were great:

45.text: a dream job that would pay the bills

47.text: for many years … but the dream has soured.

51.text: The problems began when I started fleshing out

57.text: A number of ideas presented themselves:

66.text: The others weren’t so well developed:

79.text: but just as I settled on one,

81.text: I started seeing the others everywhere I went

85.text: exactly as they were in my imagination,

90.text: It’s as if they simply willed themselves

95.text: I woke to the sound of someone at my typewriter

102.text: just a page with three unsettling words:

109.text: People tell me I’m going mad

111.text: but I know this is real;

113.text: Mr Holmes, I’m writing in the frantic hope …

116.text: JW: … that you can help me wake up

124.text: Sherlock, whoever heard of characters stepping

127.text: out of an author’s imagination and coming to life?

130.text: SH: John, quickly, find the number

131.text: get Ms. Westmacott on the phone.

133.text: I believe she’s in great danger.

135.text: SH: Don’t ‘what’ me John, just do it …

136.text: JW: Alright, alright … I don’t know.

141.text: SH: There’s something uncanny about all of this;

148.text: I’ll stake my reputation on her sanity!

150.text: No, this is the work of a good old-fashioned villain

153.text: a madman intent on driving Mary insane:

156.text: subverting her sense of fantasy and reality …

162.text: JW: Holmes, you won’t believe it!

164.text: SH: As I feared: she’s already dead.

169.text: she was murdered at her desk,

171.text: a dagger in her back, and three words

174.text: on the page in the typewriter:

179.text: The doors to the study were locked

181.text: from the inside, with no sign of forced entry.

184.text: And the manuscript for the film is gone!

192.text: Although it would appear that we have just

194.text: been engaged to work for a corpse.

196.text: Grab your coat John … the Game is On!
